benchmark_details.name: ReForm-Eval
benchmark_details.overview: ReForm-Eval is a new multi-modal benchmark that evaluates large vision language models (LVLMs) via unified re-formulation of task-oriented benchmarks into formats compatible with LVLMs. It encompasses 61 benchmark datasets, covering various dimensions of evaluation for LVLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for large vision-language models (LVLMs) by re-formulating existing benchmarks into unified formats that address LVLM capabilities.

data.source: Systematic collection and re-formulation of existing task-oriented multi-modal benchmarks into unified formats suitable for LVLM assessment.
data.annotation: Utilizes existing annotations from previously established benchmarks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the extent to which LVLM outputs match the provided benchmarks' requirements and structures.
methodology.interpretation: The model's performance is interpreted based on accuracy rates in the context of multi-choice and open-ended response requirements. High accuracy signifies successful comprehension and reasoning abilities of the LVLMs.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures involved multiple rounds of testing under varied conditions to ensure reliability of results.
